Module brickGame
Package brickGame.Model.Player

Class PlayerModel

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.shape.Shape
javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle
brickGame.Model.Player.PlayerModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Playable, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class PlayerModel extends javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle implements Playable
The PlayerModel class represents the player model. It is used to create the paddle. It also contains the methods to move the paddle. The class includes a thread-safe singleton to ensure a single instance.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static PlayerModel getInstance(Main main)
      This method is used to create a thread-safe singleton.
      Parameters:
      main - The Main instance to access the components of the game.
      Returns:
      The instance of the player model.

    • move

      public void move(int direction)
      The move method is used to move the paddle.
      Specified by:
      move in interface Playable
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction of the paddle. Either left or right.

    • blockDestroyedCount

      public void blockDestroyedCount()
      The blockDestroyedCount method is used to check the number of destroyed blocks. If the number of destroyed blocks is equal to the number of blocks, the player wins the level, and moves to the next level.
